Murmur to This Body

Aug 23, 2008

by Jonathan Clausen

Breathe deeply of clean air
when you find it.
I must have it to turn
blue to crimson,
to bring life back to
dying members of this host,
allowing myself once again to
revel in the slowness
that is the persistent beat of a drum
to which we both march.

Dance, play, run freely;
it makes my muscles stronger
to run a race of determined length.

Open me up to the deserving.
It is well and good
that your system is a closed one,
but my muscle of metaphors
wants to be shared.
Un-gifted, I atrophy and become hardened.

Treat me gently;
hope that others will do the same,
but don’t fear me.
I have wounds which fester,
and may never heal,
but endure these.
Potential rewards
tip scales on periodic pains.

You’ve told all this to me,
and to yourself, more than once.
I’ve heard you, and
what is more important
is that I have to believe you.
